name: The Best Thai Coconut Soup
description: This Thai coconut soup made with red curry paste, lemongrass, lime juice, shrimp, and fish sauce is full of authentic, bold, and tasty Thai flavors.
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add ginger, curry paste, and lemongrass; cook and stir in the hot oil for 1 minute.
Gradually stir in chicken broth, then stir in fish sauce and brown sugar; reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add coconut milk and mushrooms; cook and stir until mushrooms are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add shrimp; cook until no longer translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in lime juice; season with salt and garnish with cilantro.

video.description: The bold and delicious flavors of south-east Asia come together in this irresistible recipe for Thai coconut soup. In this video, you see how using some distinctive flavors like, lemongrass, ginger, red curry paste, fish sauce and of course coconut milk can bring out delicious results. If you're craving those flavors that fill up your body and soul, be sure to get the recipe for The Best Thai Coconut Soup.
video.name: The Best Thai Coconut Soup

name: Shirataki Meatless Meat Pad Thai
description: A fast and easy vegetarian pad Thai recipe. Stop emptying your wallet eating out and eat in!

name: Simple Shrimp Pad Thai
description: The flavor and the heat build with each bite of this shrimp pad thai, so don't taste it right out of the pan and think it needs more heat because five bites later, you will be surprised at the heat.

name: Toronto Pad Thai
description: Taken from a local chef in Toronto. You can get preserved tamarinds at a Chinese supermarket for a buck.

name: Vegetarian Phad Thai
description: This recipe is the closest I've come to imitating the heavenly Phad Thai I had in London. It's a little sweeter than the Phad Thai dishes I've tried in the U.S. Raw cabbage and/or carrots may also be served on the side.

name: Joe's Fusion Chicken Pad Thai
description: My girlfriend and I were craving pad Thai! So we looked at a few recipes and made our version. It is not exactly traditional pad Thai, so -- lo and behold -- the name!

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Raw Pad Thai
description: This is an uncooked version of pad Thai.

name: Okinawan-Style Pad Thai
description: This is a famous dish popularized in Thailand. Although the recipe varies from cook to cook and region to region, this is a good attempt at recreating what I ate from Thai-owned hole-in-the-wall restaurants in Okinawa, Japan. Key to the flavor are the sugar levels, unsalted peanuts, peanut oil, and either oyster or fish sauce.

name: Pad Thai Noodles
description: This popular Thai noodle dish has a delicate balance of spicy, sweet, salty, and sour flavors. This recipe is based on a traditional Bangkok-style version of the dish. It is not swimming in sauce like many Western versions found in restaurants. The dish is full of flavor with a light coating of delicious sauce in every bite. Serve with lime wedges, fish sauce, sugar, white pepper or pepper flakes, and vinegar on the table so guests can individually adjust tastes.

ingredients.name: Thai chile peppers
ingredients.prepare_type: seeded and minced, or more to taste

name: Zucchini Noodles Pad Thai
description: A healthier adaptation of a Pad Thai recipe. Serve with extra lime wedges.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes

name: Classic Pad Thai
description: This recipe is a perfect example of Thai cooking for beginners. Once mastered, you'll forget stopping for take-out and make this easy stir-fry a weeknight staple.

name: Pad Thai with Tofu
description: This is a favorite Thai dish that is light and combines sour, salt, sweet, and spicy flavors.

name: Soy-Free Chicken Pad Thai
description: A great option for Thai pad thai those with soy allergies!

name: Carrie's Pad Thai Salad
description: This is my favorite Pad Thai creation. After I started making it at home, I could never go back. This is a full meal, suitable for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Please enjoy!

name: Pad Thai Quinoa Bowl
description:
This recipe uses quinoa which is gluten-free, high in protein and fiber, and has a nice nutty flavor. But you can always substitute for either rice or noodles.
Take out the chicken and add extra edamame and you have a great vegetarian meal instead. Or add shrimp if you like. A seriously good, versatile recipe!

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips

name: Dad's Pad Thai
description: This is my father's pad thai recipe. It's the best, even better than what you'll find at most Thai restaurants! I like it because it's full of fresh ingredients, it's not greasy, and it's satisfying and healthy. There is no meat in this recipe.

name: A Pad Thai Worth Making
description: Pad thai, the wonderful national noodle dish of Thailand, is now served in many trendy restaurants. Make it at home with this recipe that can be adjusted to your taste. Add your favorite ingredients and make it as spicy or tart as you want to. It is also great as a basis for a stir-fry of leftovers. This is a recipe for those who like it hot  if you can't handle the heat, go easy on the chile sauce.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes

name: Chicken Pad Thai with Peanut Sauce
description: I made this chicken pad Thai with peanut sauce for my wife on her birthday and she loved it. Make sure to pick up medium rice noodles.

ingredients.name: 1/2-inch wide strips of raw chicken breast

name: Spicy Shrimp Pad Thai
description: I used other pad thai recipes from this website and added shrimp and my own little flavor and spice.

name: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai
description: This low-carb dish is tasty and filling, even if you're not watching your waistline! Spicy and flavorful, this dish is always sure to please!

name: Pad Thai
description: This is a traditional pad thai recipe used by a friend's mother. You can use chicken, pork, beef, tofu, or a combination. You may want to start with less pepper and work your way up.

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-sized pieces

name: Authentic Pad Thai Noodles
description: This is an authentic Thai recipe, with the proper ingredients (no ketchup or peanut butter). It is easy, quick, and absolutely delicious.

ingredients.name: green onions
ingredients.prepare_type: whites cut thinly across and greens sliced into thin lengths - divided

name: Sweet Rice and Mango
description: Delicious, simple dessert inspired by Thai cuisine. Refreshing and flavorful, this is a family favorite! Great after a chicken curry meal.

name: Egg and Coconut Custard Jellies
description: This recipe uses agar-agar powder and eggs to make a lovely jelly that has a slight custardy texture. The great thing about this recipe is that it does not require careful steaming, it is a sure-fire success every time.

name: Thai Coconut and Cocoa Macaroons
description: Thai cookies always have something unusual going on with them. These macaroon style cookies mix coconut, cocoa, and lime juice to create an interesting snack.

name: Sweet Sticky Rice and Mango
description: Absolutely delicious! My mom had something similar to this in a Thai restaurant and started searching for a similar recipe.

name: Steamed Pandan Tapioca Pearl Cakes
description: This is a fun and delectable little dessert to impress your friends. This recipe utilizes many typical ingredients found in Thai desserts like tapioca pearls, coconut, and pandan.

name: Mango with Sticky Coconut Rice (Kao Niaw)
description: This is my favorite Thai dessert. There is something very comforting about it. I also like to eat it for breakfast.

name: Sticky Rice with Coconut Milk and Mango
description: This recipe will allow you to create a decadent Thai desert. This is an easy and clear recipe. The steamed sweet sticky rice soaked in coconut milk and topped with sliced mango will be sure to please family and guests alike.

name: Thai Steamed Banana Cake
description: This is a denser version of the traditional banana cake and is very easy to make. You can either steam it in a square baking tin, in individual foil cups or do it the traditional way, in banana leaves.

name: Sweetened Bananas in Coconut Milk
description: This banana and coconut milk dessert is simple but very delicious for the banana lover. Bananas are simply cooked in a mixture of coconut milk and coconut cream to create a luscious treat.

ingredients.name: bananas
ingredients.prepare_type: cut in half crosswise then lengthwise

name: Thai Sticky Black Rice Pudding
description: Great Thai dessert! I originally had this dish at my favorite Thai place, and decided to try to recreate it. Almost tastes like a cobbler and ice cream. Love this dessert! Top with coconut ice cream if desired.

name: Sweet Sticky Rice with Mangoes
description: A delicious traditional Thai dessert.

name: Thai Sweet Sticky Rice With Mango (Khao Neeo Mamuang)
description: This mango sticky rice is a wonderful and authentic-tasting Thai dessert that's as good, if not better, than what you find in many Thai restaurants.

name: Tender Taro Root Cooked in Coconut Milk
description: This is a dessert that is filling but very simple to make. Use fresh and firm taro for best results.

name: Thai Hot and Sour Soup (Tom Yum)
description: A traditional Thai tom yum soup with shrimp and straw mushrooms.

ingredients.name: red curry paste (such as Thai Kitchen)

name: Andrew's Tom Kha Gai
description: Inspired from a mix of various recipes and videos found online. Goes great with a bowl of rice!

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breasts, cut into 2-inch pieces

name: Adrienne's Tom Ka Gai
description: Fragrant, spicy, and absolutely delicious Thai chicken soup. I've eaten a bit of Thai, and I think this comes very close. Add noodles if you like with the cilantro.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips

name: Instant Pot Keto Thai Chicken Soup (Tom Kha Gai)
description: This keto Thai chicken soup (Tom Kha Gai) has that perfect combination of Thai flavors: a balance of spicy, salty, sweet, and sour, all made easy with your Instant Pot.

name: Tom Kha Gai Thai Soup
description: I fell in love with my local Thai restaurant's tom kha gai soup, and this is my closest match to it. It's delicious, healthful, and filling. The galangal, ginger, and lemon grass chunks are not meant to be eaten, so they can be thrown out or put back in the pot.

name: Quick Red Curry Soup
description: Another free-styling super bowl creation based on the incredible laksas I have had the opportunity to try around my office in NYC. Enjoy!

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Mama B's Tom Kha Gai Soup
description: Another delicious recipe. This is meant to serve four as an entree.

name: Tom Yum Kai
description: I got this tom yum recipe from a Thai friend. It's the best/most authentic ever. Garnish with cilantro, basil, and green onion.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast sliced into strips

ingredients.name: fresh Thai chiles
ingredients.prepare_type: crushed with a knife and halved

name: Thai Chicken Meatball Noodle Soup
description: Enjoy a warm and aromatic bowl of soup infused with Thai flavors. Thai food typically is spicy, so adjust the heat level to your preference with the amount of red curry paste. Garnish with sliced green onions and cilantro.

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Spicy Thai Vegetable Soup
description: A delicious sweet and spicy soup perfect on a cold winter night. Best served with a loaf of crusty bread.

name: Thai Pumpkin Soup
description: This is a spicy Thai variety on our favorite pumpkin soup. You can make it mild spicy or hot spicy by using different types of chilies. Instead of the traditional sour cream, this recipe uses coconut cream. Quick 'n' easy!

name: Tom Yum Goong Soup
description: Tom yum goong soup is easy to make at home with this recipe. Koong or goong is the Thai word for shrimp, which is featured in this delicious dish. Garnish the soup with fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Authentic Thai Coconut Soup
description: This authentic Thai coconut soup is for food lovers. If you have all the ingredients on hand it's easy to put together and makes the perfect comfort food. If not, it only takes one trip to the market. It's so versatile you can make it vegetarian or substitute chicken for shrimp. Enjoy!

name: Thai Chicken Noodle Soup
description: This Thai chicken noodle soup uses red curry, red bell peppers, coconut milk, and fresh basil. A fantastic flavor combination that whips together in just minutes.

name: Thai Red Curry Chicken Soup
description: Red curry chicken is a family favorite so I adapted it into a soup. That way you never miss any of the delicious sauce!

name: The Best Thai Tom Kha Soup Recipe
description: Tom Kha Gai is a Thai chicken coconut soup aromatic of lemongrass, lime leaves, and galangal, gives you a refreshing aftertaste with a creamy taste from coconut.

ingredients.name: lemongrass
ingredients.prepare_type: tough outer parts removed, thinly sliced

ingredients.name: boneless chicken thighs
ingredients.prepare_type: cut against the grain into bite-sized pieces

name: Khao Soi Soup
description: From northern Thailand, a noodle soup with an amazing mix of flavor and texture. My mom made this for me recently, and I fell in love with it. It is a variation on a recipe about street food she found in her local paper. It is quite flavorful, so if you prefer a less spicy dish, reduce the amount of spices.

name: Thai Hot and Sour Soup
description: Fantastic authentic Thai hot and sour soup. Ideal as a starter in a Thai meal. Not very filling, but a great appetizer. Very quick and easy to prepare. The tom yum paste is hot, so try the soup before adding the chile and decide if any extra heat is required. Do not attempt if you do not have fresh coriander, as this is vital!

name: Tom Ka Gai (Coconut Chicken Soup)
description: The quintessential Thai soup.

name: Instant Pot Thai Chicken Soup
description: Our recipe for Instant Pot Thai Chicken Soup delivers authentic flavor with a rich base of Swanson Chicken Broth and ingredients easy to find at the grocery store. The best part  you can have it on the table in only 50 minutes.

ingredients.name: carrots
ingredients.prepare_type: peeled and cut into matchstick-size pieces

name: Homemade Tom Yum Soup
description: This tom yum soup recipe is easier than most hot and sour soup recipes you will find. I have simplified a sometimes complex recipe for those like me who can have a hard time finding some of the original ingredients. This is my favorite recipe, better than any tom yum in the many restaurants I have been to.

name: Tom Kha Gai
description: An easy and healthy Thai chicken soup. Serve over rice. Add more fish sauce or chile paste to taste.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips

name: Thai-Style Grapefruit and Prawns
description: Super starter, sensually spicy.

name: Thai Banana Salsa with King Prawns
description: Extremely refreshing. I make extra salsa to keep in the fridge for a pick-me-up after a long day at uni. You can serve it on a banana leaf with lime wedges.

name: Po Piah (Thai Spring Rolls)
description: This is my favorite snack of all times. It's a little bit time consuming to make, but I usually make a big batch and freeze them. They can be deep-fried frozen. Serve them with spring roll sauce or sweet chile sauce and Thai ajad, pickled cucumber salad.

name: Hoy Lai Pad Nam Prik Pow (Clams with Chili Paste and Basil)
description: Clams prepared this way always garner standing ovations from my guests. Little do they know that it is a very fast and uncomplicated dish to prepare. For that reason--and of course for its delicious taste--I love making this dish.

name: Thai Buffalo Wings
description: Spicy and slightly sweet with unique flavors.

ingredients.name: hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot)
Asian sweet chile sauce (such as Mae Ploy Sweet Chilli Sauce)

name: Fresh Spring Rolls With Thai Dipping Sauce
description: These Thai fresh spring rolls are a healthy treat. Science says: Shrimp is a good low-fat, high-protein substitute for meat and does not raise cholesterol.

ingredients.name: spring roll wrappers (available in Asian markets)
white wine vinegar or rice vinegar

name: Chili Chicken
description: A tasty version of drumsticks with a bit of sweetness and spiciness. Thai sweet chili sauce adds an Asian flair.

name: One-Bite Thai "Flavor Bomb" Salad Wraps (Miang Kham)
description: This is one of the most delicious, most exciting appetizers of all time. I've only had my mind blown a few times, but when I tried miang kham, that was one of those times. A savory, yet sweet sauce pulls together the intense, immense flavors that these salad bombs hold, and they're perfect for serving at parties.

name: Thai Chicken Wings
description: My mother introduced me to this recipe and it is wonderful! So easy and delicious, a perfect spicy appetizer!

name: Thai Basil Rolls with Hoisin-Peanut Sauce
description: Shrimp and pork - layered with rice noodles, bean sprouts, and herbs - all rolled together in a fresh rice wrapper and served with a hoisin-peanut sauce for dipping. Great for an appetizer or lunch!

ingredients.name: fresh Thai basil - leaves picked from stems

name: Spring Rolls
description: These tasty spring rolls are packed with vegetables, seafood and pork. They contain a lot of ingredients but are worth the effort. Serve them with your favorite sauce. Some types of mushrooms may need to be soaked 2 to 3 hours before use. Ground turkey may be substituted for pork.

name: How to Make Beef Satay
description: This beef satay recipe is the main course-size version of a fabulous Thai appetizer: strips of beef marinated in Asian spices, skewered, and grilled for a truly amazing combination of flavors. With grilling season still in full swing, you can never have enough new and exciting ways to enjoy beef. Serve with my peanut dipping sauce.

ingredients.name: 2-inch piece of fresh lemon grass (white part only)

name: Ajad (Authentic Thai Cucumber Salad)
description: This fresh pickle is the classic accompaniment to many deep-fried and barbequed Thai appetizers and some curries. It's best made a few hours before serving.

name: Classic Chicken Pad Thai
description: Make classic Thai noodles at home with this chicken pad Thai recipe. The sauce is made from scratch using Thai favorites like fish sauce, tamarind paste, and shrimp paste.

name: Instant Pot Thai-Style Green Curry Chicken
description: This Thai-style chicken has a creamy green coconut curry sauce with just the right amount of spice, and is made quickly and easily in your Instant Pot. It is delicious served with rice.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken thighs, chopped into bite-sized pieces

name: Thai Monkfish Curry
description: Fragrant, warming and delicious curry-tinged soup, lovely over rice. Adjust curry paste to increase or decrease heat. Curry paste is available in jars in Asian stores and the international aisle of many grocery stores.

name: Chef John's Drunken Noodles
description: I did have a drink or three while making these, so I could enjoy them as the food gods intended, which is slightly drunk. At least that's the main theory on how this dish got its name. The other theory is that it got its name because at one point it was made with wine but that's not as entertaining! Serve garnished with Thai basil and lime, if desired.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken thighs, cut into strips (Optional)

name: Instant Pot Red Thai Curry Chicken
description: Thai red curry chicken is a quick and delicious soup with chicken, onions, and bell peppers. Enjoy hot with jasmine rice. If you like, add Thai basil leaves.

name: Thai Chicken Curry in Coconut Milk
description: This recipe is one of the favorites in the family! If you don't have fish sauce available, try making it with soy sauce.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast meat - cut into strips

name: Thai Red Chicken Curry
description: This is a quick and easy curry stir-fry made with chicken, zucchini, red bell pepper and carrot. Coconut milk and curry paste make an irresistible sauce. No need to go out to eat, as this dish is ready in about 20 minutes!

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips

name: Authentic Thai Green Curry
description: This is a classic Thai green curry (kaeng kiau wan) and my favorite curry of all time! You can substitute chicken or tofu for the pork, but make sure you serve it with lots of jasmine rice.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Massaman Curry
description: This slow cooker chicken Massaman curry is creamy, slightly spicy, nutty, and rich with flavor.

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces

ingredients.name: mixed red
ingredients.prepare_type: yellow, and orange bell peppers, cut into bite-sized chunks (Optional)

ingredients.name: Thai red curry paste (such as Maesri Masaman Curry)
fresh ginger paste (such as Gourmet Garden)

name: Nong's Khao Man Gai
description: Thai native Nong Poonsukwattana worked her way up from Portland kitchens, refining her recipe for khao man gai, saving her money and eventually landing her own spot within Portland's highly competitive food cart scene.

name: Thai Chicken
description: This delicious Thai chicken recipe was created when we felt like having spicy Asian-style food. It uses bold ingredients such as peanut butter, fresh ginger, and sesame oil. Serve over rice.

name: Crab Fried Rice
description: This crab fried rice is very easy and so popular in Thai and Chinese cuisines. Try this recipe, and you'll find it has a very nice taste. Serve with chili in fish sauce (called nam pla prik in Thai). Enjoy!

name: Chicken Satay
description: Delicious chicken satay made with marinated chicken in a peanut sauce, then grilled for a crowd-pleasing appetizer. Why go out for Thai food when you can make it at home?

ingredients.name: skewers
ingredients.prepare_type: or as needed, soaked in water for 15 minutes

name: Thai Steamed Mussels
description: These easy Thai mussels are deliciously spicy and can be finished in just 30 minutes.

name: Thai Pineapple Chicken Curry
description: This pineapple curry is a quick and easy Thai curry dish that's sweet and spicy. I became enamored with this dish at a local restaurant and then worked to duplicate it at home. I think I've got the taste and presentation pegged. I'm guesstimating the amounts since I don't measure much when I cook. Feel free to adjust to taste.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into thin strips

name: Curried Coconut Chicken
description: This chicken coconut curry recipe features chicken simmered in coconut milk and tomatoes for a mouthwatering hint of the tropics! Goes well with rice and vegetables.

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Thai Spicy Basil Chicken Fried Rice
description: This Thai basil fried rice is a staple of Thai cooking and a great use for leftover rice. Adjust the spices to your tastes. I get Thai basil from a local Asian market. It has a different flavor than regular basil and makes all the difference in this recipe. It is fast and fairly easy to make but requires constant stirring.

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips

name: Panang Curry with Chicken
description: Panang curry with chicken represents the diversity of Thailand's southern region. Panang refers to the island of Penang in Northern Malaysia bordering southern Thailand. Use 4 tablespoons curry paste from a fresh curry paste recipe or 5 tablespoons pre-made curry paste if time does not permit making your own paste

name: Thai Green Curry Chicken
description: This Thai green curry recipe never fails to please! It is quick and easy to make and the chicken stays moist and tender. Serve over jasmine rice for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes

name: Authentic Pad Thai
description: This is an authentic pad thai recipe with rice noodles, chicken, peanuts, and stir-fried eggs in a traditional tamarind sauce. Garnish with fresh bean spouts and chives. This recipe was inspired by the pad thai at Thai Tom.

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breast halves, sliced into thin strips

name: Slow Cooker Beef Massaman Curry
description: Beef massaman curry is a famous Thai beef stew that is the best of 2 worlds - it has the texture of stew with the flavor of curry. The sauce is intensely savory, thick, and luscious. Make sure you are using a good-quality curry paste (like Maesri) so you will get great depth of flavor without a lot of work.

ingredients.name: chopped fresh cilantro leaves and stems

name: Chicken Massaman Curry
description: This massaman curry recipe, flavored with tamarind and coconut milk, is ready in under an hour. Serve over plain white rice.

name: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)
description: My version of this classic Thai dish has spectacular taste even with regular basil instead of Thai or holy basil. The sauce actually acts like a glaze as the chicken mixture cooks over high heat. The recipe works best if you chop or grind your own chicken and have all ingredients prepped before you start cooking.

ingredients.name: very thinly sliced fresh basil leaves

name: Khao Man Gai Thai Chicken and Rice (Healthy Version)
description: Khao man gai or khao mun gai, literally meaning oily rice [with] chicken, is one of the most popular Thai dishes; it can be found everywhere in Thailand from streetfood stalls to restaurants. It is originally from Hainan, China. In Thailand, khao man gai is served with cucumbers, chicken blood tofu, coriander, and a bowl of soup. The heart of khao man gai is the sauce! This recipe is a healthy version of khao man gai; I used less oil and chicken breasts instead of the parts of chicken with fat and skin. Enjoy!

name: Pad Krapao (Thai Stir-Fry Pork with Basil)
description: Pad krapao (or pad kra pao) is a tasty Thai favorite. Serve with rice. Top with a fried egg, if desired.

name: Sukhothai Pad Thai
description: This Sukhothai pad thai can be made with shrimp, chicken, or pork instead of tofu. You can also look for items in the Asian foods section at your local grocery store. Adjust the pad thai sauce ingredients to taste.

name: Grilled Mahi Mahi in Thai Coconut Sauce
description: Grilled mahi mahi fillets in a Thai coconut sauce made with cilantro, ginger, and lime juice. Serve with steamed squash.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry with Thai Peanut Sauce
description: This made-from-scratch peanut sauce is thick, rich, and spicy. Serve over rice noodles or steamed jasmine or brown rice with a sweet-and-sour cucumber salad for a refreshing side dish that complements the peanut sauce.

name: Pad Kee Mao
description: Pad kee mao translates to "drunken stir-fry" in English. These Thai drunken noodles are one variation of many such dishes that are commonly hawked by street-side vendors in Bangkok. The drunken description comes from the fact that it originated in late-night revelers' kitchens after stumbling home from the nightclubs in the wee hours of the morning.

name: Amazing Simple Thai Tofu
description: You'd never guess it's Tofu! Peanut and ginger flavors combine to create a wonderful Asian-flavored dish that everyone will love. Serve over white rice.

name: Goong Tod Kratiem Prik Thai (Prawns Fried with Garlic and White Pepper)
description: This dish is a classic Thai preparation of protein. It's a very satisfying dish, especially made with shell-on shrimp. We eat shrimp, shells and all, so we don't miss out on any flavor. It's also a kid-friendly dinner dish. Serve with lots of rice.

name: Thai Chicken Stock
description: This Thai stock is the base for making most of the popular Thai soups like tom yum and tom kha gai (coconut chicken soup).

name: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
description: This recipe for chicken satay with peanut sauce features flavorful Thai-style chicken skewers and a sweet and spicy peanut sauce. Serve with white rice for a complete meal!

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips

name: Thai Basil Chicken with Coconut Curry Sauce
description: A classic Thai basil chicken curry with coconut milk. Serve over jasmine rice and garnish with basil leaves.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips

ingredients.name: kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Thai Ground Chicken Basil
description: This delicious recipe most closely resembles my favorite Thai restaurant's Ground Chicken Basil. I've searched for recipes, but none gave this authentic taste. It's quick and easy, too! Serve with steamed rice if you like.

name: Thai Chicken with Basil Stir Fry
description: This is delicious and easy to make. Make it as spicy as you like or keep it mild.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1/2 inch strips

name: Curry Pineapple Fried Rice
description: This is my version of a pineapple and curry fried rice dish served at my favorite Thai restaurant. You might think that the flavors of curry and pineapple wouldn't go together, but they do.

name: Thai Beef Curry
description: My son and I doctored up a Thai beef curry recipe from a local upscale restaurant using what we had and liked. We were both impressed and will make this again. Serve over cooked rice.

name: Slow Cooker Thai Peanut Pork
description: This is an easy Thai peanut pork dish that your whole family will enjoy.

name: Thai Pork with Peanut Sauce
description: This recipe for Thai pork chops is a very simple and quick dish that combines the standard pork chop with the wonderful flavor of coconut and peanuts. Even the kids loved it.

name: Thai Noodles
description: A spicy Thai noodle dish with chicken and vegetables.

name: Thai-Style Ground Pork Skewers
description: Street-style garlicky Thai ground pork skewers with lots of sweet and savory umami flavor. These are excellent broiled or grilled and served over rice noodles with nuoc cham dipping sauce, on top of steamed rice with a fried egg, or in a sandwich with a slick of aioli and lots of fresh Thai herbs. Baking powder is traditional and gives the pork its signature bouncy texture.

name: Thai Chicken Satay
description: This Thai chicken satay recipe is quick to prep, but best if the chicken is left to marinate for a few hours or more. Skewer up for the grill or cook on the stove, and serve with Thai peanut sauce.

ingredients.name: skinless
ingredients.prepare_type: boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips

name: Thai Fried Rice with Pineapple and Chicken
description: This pineapple fried rice with chicken is a Bangkok street food recipe I snagged on a recent trip there. When available, use fresh pineapple, and serve the rice in the hollowed pineapple shell. Enjoy.

name: Slow Cooker Thai Pork with Peppers
description: Pork, peppers, and spices are cooked in a Thai peanut sauce until aromatic and tender. Served over brown or jasmine rice with steamed carrots on the side, this dish makes a satisfying meal.

ingredients.name: red bell peppers
ingredients.prepare_type: thinly sliced and cut into bite-size lengths

name: Thai Beef Fried Rice
description: This fried rice is made with ground beef, and is Thai home cooking at its best! Enjoy the delicious flavor that the soy sauce, fish sauce, and fresh tomato bring to this version of fried rice.

ingredients.name: finely chopped green onion (white and light green parts)
salt and ground black pepper to taste

name: Spicy Thai Peanut Noodles
description: This Thai peanut noodle dish is a delicious recipe with just the right amount of heat! It's simple to prepare, but requires a bit of organization while assembling/cooking, because it goes quickly. Preparing your ingredients beforehand is key! For vegetarians, you can make this without the chicken and fish sauce and it tastes just as good! Serve hot. You could also garnish this with chopped unsalted peanuts.

ingredients.name: boneless
ingredients.prepare_type: skinless chicken breasts, cut into 3/4-inch cubes

name: Very Spicy Thai Green Chicken Curry
description: This is an EXTREMELY hot Thai curry with homemade curry paste. All you people out there who're thinking "Hot? Yeah right", try it! Serve over Thai fragrant rice.

name: Khanom Jeeb (Pork and Shrimp Dumplings)
description: Like people the world over, Thai people have a habit of incorporating foreign dishes into their cuisine. Khanom jeeb is a Thai take on a classic Chinese dim sum dish.

name: Thai Shrimp Fried Rice (Kao Pad Goong)
description: Who doesn't love fried rice? Seasoned rice mixed with veggies, egg, and shrimp-it's a complete and satisfying one-dish meal! I enjoyed this rendition which was heavy on the garlic and scallion and seasoned with fish sauce and soy sauce. Serve with sliced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and lime wedges, and garnish with thinly sliced scallions. .

name: Satay Chicken Pizza
description: This recipe was developed in response to hunger, a creative impulse, and a lack of other food in the house. It's great. Really.

name: Slow Cooker Thai Green Chicken Curry
description: This Thai green chicken curry made in the slow cooker is super easy and versatile!

name: Thai Fried Rice
description: This Thai fried rice is called American fried rice (Khao Pad American) in Thailand, because it uses ingredients that are considered American, like ketchup and bacon. It is very popular in Thailand and easy to make. All ingredients should be prepped in advance cause once you start frying the rice, it goes fast. If people are really hungry, you can serve a fried egg on top of the fried rice.
